question: Electric field at a distance 'r' from an infinitely long uniformly charged straight conductor, having linear charge density <katex>$\lambda$</katex> is E1. Another uniformly charged conductor having same linear charge density <katex>$\lambda$</katex> is bent into a semicircle of radius 'r'. The electric field at its centre is E2. Then
explanation: Field at center of semicircle ring <katex>$E_2 = \frac{2k\lambda}{r}$</katex>.
